Name: Necklace of unglazed faience beads
Description: String of large spherical beads, without trace of glaze. Ball beads are often found in Middle Kingdom burials, and depictions indicate that they were worn by men as well as women. The beads could be worn singly or in necklaces arranged in increasing order of size. Women sometimes attached them to their wigs, forming artificial plaits of bright blue or silver white.
